pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.16.1: [Sp.2.886](): _Sacepi udakasāṭikacīvaraṃ mahagghaṃ hoti, na sakkā nivāsetvā bahi gantuṃ, evampi naggāya nhāyituṃ vaṭṭati_; “Also, if her bathing robe is valuable, or she is unable to put on a lower robe before going outside, then it is allowable to bathe naked.” The implication of this is that this rule concerns outdoor bathing, which fits the origin story.
